title: Enhanced Transportation for Atzeres Tefillah
body: Israeli Transportation Minister Mrs. Miri Regev announced enhanced public transportation for Thursday's large atzeres tefillah in Yerushalayim, increasing service where heavy traffic is expected.

title: Rav Shaul Alter's Heartfelt Letter
body: Rav Shaul Alter, Gerer Rosh Yeshiva, wrote a moving letter to the Angrest family, thanking Hashem for the miracle of Matan's return after two years in Hamas captivity beneath Gaza.

title: Torah Protest Postponed
body: A massive asifa against the persecution of Torah learners, initially set for Sunday, is now likely to take place on Monday or Tuesday due to logistical challenges. The Slabodka roshei yeshiva, Rav Dov Landau and Rabbi [missing name], made the announcement after various factions requested more time for preparation.

title: Vandalism at Vizhnitzer Cemetery
body: Vandalism at the historic Vizhnitsa cemetery in Ukraine has sparked outrage among Vizhnitzer Chassidim. Antisemitic vandals broke in under cover of night, trampling and smashing several gravestones of generations of Vizhnitzer Rebbes.

title: Rav Moshe Maya Calls for Unity
body: Rav Moshe Maya, senior member of the Moetzet Chachmei HaTorah of Shas, urges the chareidi community to attend a massive atzeres tefillah in Yerushalayim following the arrests of yeshiva bochurim who refused to report to army draft offices.
